intro: Gomphrena incana, commonly known as the common gomphrena, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, spiky inflorescences that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are often arranged in dense, spherical clusters. Gomphrena incana is valued for its ornamental appeal and is commonly cultivated in gardens and as a cut flower.
